discourse_list.title: Flux Finance - DeFi meets Real World Assets

content.content: If Maker folks have not already heard about the new DAO, Flux Finance, they may find this interesting. Flux is a fork of Compound V2 that allows for assets with transfer restrictions, like many tokenized securities. Like Compound, Flux follows a peer-to-pool model and is designed to always quote a lend and borrow rate based on supply and demand. Assuming the first Flux governance proposal passes, Flux will support permissionless lending pools backed by OUSG—a tokenized exposure to short term, U.S. Treasuries.  Given OUSG’s expected yield is 4.2%+, the lending pool should yield around 3.5%. Anyway, take a look - we would love to get Maker’s feedback on Flux.    Flux Finance – 12 Jan 23    Announcing Flux Finance: DeFi Meets Real World Assets We are delighted to unveil Flux Finance, a decentralized lending protocol that can support both permissionless cryptoassets alongside permissioned tokens.  DeFi has proved to be remarkably robust amidst the collapse of a wave of opaque, centralized...      More info on OUSG    Ondo Finance    Ondo Finance Institutional Grade Finance. On-Chain. For Everyone.

Hi Eric, This post has been flagged as spam by a Community member. As you’re a former CU contributor, I’m sure that isn’t your intention so I’m reluctant to remove the post. Perhaps you could elaborate more about Flux and its relevance to Maker and DAI? Currently, this is just a press release from an unrelated protocol. Edit: Thanks for editing the OP!
The issue always is execution is much more difficult than theories. So will have to see how the protocol functions in first year or two
